pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.2: the monks from the group of six were arguing with the good monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.4: “These monks from the group of six are shameless;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.5: it’s not possible to argue with them.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.6: And the monks from the group of six said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.7: “Why are you slandering us by calling us shameless?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.10: The monks of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.11: “How can the monks from the group of six eavesdrop on monks they are arguing and disputing?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.12: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.15: “… Foolish men, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.16: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.17: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:1.18.1: ‘If a monk eavesdrops on monks who are arguing and disputing, thinking, “I’ll hear what they say,” and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.8: who are engaged in a legal issue.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.10: if he is on his way to eavesdrop, thinking, “After hearing what they say, I’ll accuse them,” “… I’ll remind them,” “… I’ll counter-accuse them,” “… I’ll counter-remind them,” “… I’ll humiliate them,” he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.11: Wherever he stands to listen, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.12: If he is walking behind someone, and he speeds up with the intention to eavesdrop, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.13: Wherever he stands to listen, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.14: If he is walking in front of someone, and he slows down with the intention to eavesdrop, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.15: Wherever he stands to eavesdrop, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.16: If he goes to where a monk who is speaking privately is standing, seated, or lying down, he should clear his throat or make his presence known. If he does not clear his throat or make his presence known, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.17: He does so only for this reason and no other:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.1.18: there is no other reason for eavesdropping.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.1: If it is one who is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he eavesdrops on him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.2: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he eavesdrops on him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.3: If it is one who is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he eavesdrops on him, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.4: If he eavesdrops on one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.5: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.6: If it is one who is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.2.7: If it is one who is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.2: if he goes, thinking, “After hearing what they say, I’ll refrain,” “… I’ll abstain,” “… I’ll resolve it,” “… I’ll free myself;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.4: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc78:2.3.5: The eighth rule, the training rule on eavesdropping, is finished.
